description: From Middle English noysom; equivalent to noy +‎ -some (short for annoy, from an(n)oien, enoien from Anglo-Norman anuier, from Old French enuier (French ennuyer), from Late Latin inodiare (“to make hateful”), from in- (intensive prefix) + odium (“hate”)).

adjectives.description: noisome (comparative more noisome, superlative most noisome)

entries.meaning: (literary) Hurtful or noxious to health; unwholesome, insalubrious.
(literary) Offensive to the senses; disgusting, unpleasant, nauseous, especially having an undesirable smell.
